channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Footpath at end of Gordon Road overgrown, 26th November
item.description:
The footpath / cycle path that continues from Gordon Road to Brent Way is overgrown with brambles, buddleia and other plants. Pedestrians need to walk on the cycle path at this point. This overgrowth has been there for months.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): d, Lovers Walk, West Finchley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wonky and wobbly lamppost, 26th November
item.description:
The lamppost appears to be effected by either a trades vehicle or high winds - I suspect the former. The lamppost is no longer vertical. The concreate around the base no longer fully touches the lamppost. I am able to wobble the lamppost by hand. I only noticed this today.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Van abandoned, 26th November
item.description:
This vehicle has had no MOT or Tax since August 2025 and has been abdoned outside 101 Brownspring Drive on the street. It was dumped in the earlier hours of the morning of 23/9/2025. Despite contacting you before via this platform on 14 Oct 2025 there has still has been no response to the last report. It is also causing a problem for other vehicles and residents
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brownspring Drive, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Three large plane trees in need of lopping at corner of Somerville/Courtenay Roads, 26th November
item.description:
These trees are very tall (some 80-90 feet) and need some extreme lopping. It has been some considerable time since they were last lopped and the foliage produced causes guttering to be blocked, and dangerous to walk on when wet. Can you advise if these are earmarked for treatment in the near future.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Blenheim Road, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
